Package com.amonson.node_monitoring

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amonson.node_monitoring.Message
  • public class Message
extends java.lang.Object
    Message class for messages handled by the NodeMonitoringZeroMQ class.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  Message.FECallback
      Functional interface for callback forEachTargetDo() target name in this instance.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Message

        public Message​(java.lang.String topic,
               java.lang.String sender,
               java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> targets,
               java.lang.String... messageParts)
        Create a Message instance with topic, sender, target(s) and optional payload parts.
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic used to send the message. If the topic is not registered by peers the message will be lost.
        sender - This is your hostname, network resolvable. Use of non-resolvable names here will result in lost messages.
        targets - The list of targets to send the message. The collection cannot be null or empty.
        messageParts - The list of message parts of the payload. It is acceptable to not have any payload parts.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if topic and sender are null or empty, also if targets is null or length 0.

      • Message

        public Message​(java.lang.String topic,
               java.lang.String sender,
               java.lang.String targets,
               java.lang.String... messageParts)
        Create a Message instance with topic, sender, target(s) and optional payload parts.
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic used to send the message. If the topic is not registered by peers the message will be lost.
        sender - This is your hostname, network resolvable. Use of non-resolvable names here will result in lost messages.
        targets - The list of targets to send the message. The string is a comma separated list with no spaces.
        messageParts - The list of message parts of the payload. It is acceptable to not have any payload parts.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if topic, sender or targets are null or empty.

      • Message

        public Message​(java.lang.String topic,
               java.lang.String sender,
               java.lang.String targets,
               java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> messageParts)
        Create a Message instance with topic, sender, target(s) and optional payload parts.
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic used to send the message. If the topic is not registered by peers the message will be lost.
        sender - This is your hostname, network resolvable. Use of non-resolvable names here will result in lost messages.
        targets - The list of targets to send the message. The string is a comma separated list with no spaces.
        messageParts - The list of message parts of the payload. It is acceptable to use 0 parts in the collection.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if topic, sender or targets are null or empty.

      • Message

        public Message​(java.lang.String topic,
               java.lang.String sender,
               java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> targets,
               java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> messageParts)
        Create a Message instance with topic, sender, target(s) and optional payload parts.
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic used to send the message. If the topic is not registered by peers the message will be lost.
        sender - This is your hostname, network resolvable. Use of non-resolvable names here will result in lost messages.
        targets - The list of targets to send the message. The collection cannot be null or empty.
        messageParts - The list of message parts of the payload. It is acceptable to use 0 parts in the collection.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if topic and sender are null or empty, also if targets is null or length 0.

      • targetsContains

        public boolean targetsContains​(java.lang.String node)
        Check if the hostname node passed is in the targets list of this instance.
        Parameters:
        node - The hostname to check for inclusion in the targets list.
        Returns:
        true indicates the passed node is present in the targets list, false otherwise.
